comments.body: I chose to use a state machine here in case the header delimiter was broken up across multiple batches.  Not sure how I feel about the verbosity yet.

I have a feeling we may be able to avoid this state machine by using fastparse-bytes http://www.lihaoyi.com/fastparse/#ByteParsers `Bytes ++ Bytes` and `Bytes.apply(index: Int)` are near constant. `.parse` takes an optional starting index which can be used to start parsing from somewhere inside the index.

super minor, but instead of `"UTF-8"` you can do

```scala
import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets.UTF_8
new String(unusedBuffer.result(), UTF_8)
```

same with other Java operations that require a charset, like `getBytes`.
